snippet: Having already split with Mr. Trump over endorsing Paul Ryan, Mr. Pence told a Virginia television news station he would also support two snubbed Republican senators....
abstract: Republican vice presidential nominee Mike Pence, breaking rank against Donald Trump for second time, endorses several Republican senators running for re-election that Trump had previously snubbed.

byline.original: By ALEXANDER BURNS and NOAH REMNICK
byline.contributor: Alexander Burns reported from Portland, and Noah Remnick from Raleigh, N.C. John Corrales contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Having already split with Mr. Trump over endorsing Paul Ryan, Mr. Pence told a Virginia television news station he would also support two snubbed Republican senators.

headline.main: Donald Trump and Mike Pence Again Diverge on Endorsements
headline.print_headline: Pence Breaks Ranks With Trump, Again, to Support Snubbed Republican Senators
